intro: Lathyrus nissolia subsp. nissolia, commonly known as the Nissolian grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of small, pea-like flowers in shades of pink or purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets, and it has a fibrous root system. This species is often found in grasslands, meadows, and along the edges of woodlands.
